review.body:
Great Read!!!

I really liked this book. It was a funny yet serious thriller. It was a page turner with a surprise ending.

Quite entertaining!

Loved that the author did some historical homework before putting the plot on paper. I learned some things. This is fast paced and the story drew me in quite easily, I couldn't put it down.

Nicole is left an estate on Starfish Island by an aunt that she's never met. Yet she's hearing voices while she sleeps, encounters locked doors and staff who fight her on every turn. Can Nicole discover who is trying to force her out of her home before her world comes tumbling down?

After reading...
some stories are better than others, as with all collections of short stories. i read it when i was 16, perhaps i'd like it better a decade later?

Great Closing to This series

Finally we get to read the never ending cliffhanger of all cliffhangers of a story!

Michelle certainly Brough alot fondant, action and romance to this couple! Xavier Cold is a much loved characters that all ladies would want to get there hands on.

I higher recommend to...

I enjoyed this book. No! it was not comparable to Gone Girl however, it definitely had its cray cray factor. I could have passed on the lengthy background of Jodi's childhood abuse. I felt that the villain got what he deserved in the end.

I thought the cover was rather fantastic and this was further emphasized when I read the story. The story also appealed very much to me as an older reader as it further emphasized the point that it is never too late to re-start your life (especially to uproot yourself) into completely new surroun...
I liked this book but the movie adaptation was a real let down for the whole series.

كل شئ نعتقد اننا نسيناه يستوطن اعماقنا،في ذلك الصندوق الذي ما ان يفتح حتي تتغير كل قوانيين الطبيعه ،يولد الماضي في الحاضر،يبعث الاموات من جديد،وتتصبب اجسادنا عرقا في برد الشتاء ،وترتعش بردا في حر الصيف.

عبد العزيز عشريني ،يعيش وحيدا مع ماضيه ،ما بين فتره الطفوله والاحتلال (حادثة مقتل والده)،ومن ثم...

it was amazing,The best book I ever read ,I adore it
Gill Lewis is the best
4.5 stars!!
წიგნი, რომელიც უნდა წაიკითხო მაშინ თუ ფილმი არ გაქვს ნანახი ან დიდი ხნის წნის ნახე და უკვე დაგავიწყდა.

Good book. The story line was good. Kept turning the pages to find out who destroyed Ryley's & Evan's future together. My heart was hurting a little bit more for Evan as the days go by where Ryley didn't give neither of them an answer.
A fine story of struggle and family and forgiveness
Perfect book for early twenties. The characters are vivid and real. This book portraits the tough life but still let readers believe in the core part of our souls.

book.title: The Blood of Olympus (The Heroes of Olympus, #5)

review.body: A nice end to the series, but after ten books in the universe I don't remember half the details and events referenced in the book. Quests and characters were mentioned that I was certain I'd never read about, which unfortunately resulted in me feeling like I was missing something important.

user.name: Wisam
user.location: Abu Dhabi, 03, The United Arab Emirates

review.body: يعالج الكتاب موضوع القدرة المعلوماتية ودورها في الهيمنة العسكرية حيث يسقط المؤلف الأمثلة على قدرات الولايات المتحدة الإمريكية العسكرية ويقارنها بقوة الصين والأتحاد الأوروبي واليابان وروسيا. وينبه المؤلف إلى أن الانفتاح المعلوماتي يجب أن يرافقه انفتاح السوق والديمقراطية والتخلي عن الهوية والقومية...

The story revolves around the protagonist Arjun , who falls in love with her colleague Anita,
Anita is a software tester , she is into marketing and promotions.
She had just moved into Chennai after her Bachelor degree in Engineering in Pondicherry . She was unsettled in terms of residence and was...

A good fast paced read

A great book, I love her characters , they are just fantastic. I would recommend this series of books to all my friends.

book.title: I Am Malala: The Girl Who Stood Up for Education and Was Shot by the Taliban

review.body: Her story, plight and courage to fight and be heard against all odds deserve a five plus. Her passion for education from an early age truly inspiring. I rated it a three for the written book itself, good not outstanding. However, the book does have some good points on the history of Pakistan and...
